com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers

Class AbstractWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers.AbstractWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Writer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractDecorativeWriter, AbstractOutputStreamWriter, ListWriter, NullWriter, StringWriter, TextWriter

    public abstract class AbstractWriter
extends Object
implements Writer
    Convenience superclass for writers.

    Subclasses only need to provide a write method. The clear method is not supported, so writers that would like to offer buffer functionality should not call the super method from their clear methods.

    The close method sets a closed flag. This flag is checked by the checkOpen method, which can be called from methods that depend on the writer not being closed.

    • Method Detail

      • checkOpen

        protected void checkOpen()
                  throws AluminumException
        Checks whether this writer is open and throws an exception if it isn't. This method can be invoked from the write, clear, and flush methods to avoid operating on a closed writer.
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when this writer is closed

      • clear

        public void clear()
           throws AluminumException
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        Removes all objects that have been written to this writer since the last time it was flushed. Not all writers support this operation.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface Writer
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when this writer is closed or can't be cleared

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws AluminumException
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        Flushes everything that has been written to this writer. If there's nothing to flush, nothing will happen. If this writer wraps another writer, the underlying writer will be flushed as well.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface Writer
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when this writer is closed or when something goes wrong while flushing

      • close

        public void close()
           throws AluminumException
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        Flushes and closes this writer. If this writer wraps another writer, that writer will be closed as well.

        After a writer has been closed, it can no longer be used.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Writer
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when this writer can't be closed or has already been closed
